items.summary:
Purpose 

This module introduces new & existing employees to the importance of building resilience in the workplace. 

The module addresses the effects of workplace events on individual stress and goal-achievement, and how building resilience can benefit the individual’s ability to “bounce back” and stay on track. 

Learning outcomes 

By completing this module participants will be able to: 

  • Define resilience and outline why it is important in the workplace 
  • Identify a range of situations within and outside their locus of control 
  • Recognise how individual character strengths can help build resilience 
  • Demonstrate how the skill of resilience can be applied to “bounce back”. 

 Topics 

Topics addressed in this module are: 

  • Definition and benefits of resilience 
  • Internal locus of control, self-awareness, and self-regulation 
  • Recognising and utilizing character strengths 
  • “Bouncing back” from unavoidable setbacks and retaining focus. 

This module should take 20 minutes to complete.

items.summary:
Business Analysis Master Class Syllabus

I. Introduction to Business Analysis

  • A. Overview

    In this section, participants will be introduced to the role of business analysis and its significance in driving organizational success.

  • B. Business Analysis Frameworks

    Participants will learn about the various frameworks and methodologies used in business analysis, including the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) and the Agile Extension to the BABOK.

  • C. Business Analysis Process

    Participants will learn about the business analysis process and how it contributes to the successful delivery of projects.

  • D. Business Analysis Techniques

    Participants will learn about the various techniques used in business analysis, including requirements gathering, modeling, and prototyping.

II. Requirements Gathering and Management

  • A. Stakeholder Analysis

    Participants will learn about stakeholder analysis and how to identify, prioritize, and engage stakeholders in the requirements gathering process.

  • B. Requirements Elicitation

    Participants will learn about the various techniques used for requirements elicitation, including interviews, workshops, and surveys.

  • C. Requirements Documentation

    Participants will learn about the importance of documenting requirements and how to create clear and concise requirement specifications.

  • D. Requirements Management

    Participants will learn about requirements management, including how to maintain and update requirements throughout the project life cycle.

III. Business Process Modeling

  • A. Overview

    Participants will learn about the various types of business process models and how they are used to represent the flow of business processes.

  • B. Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)

    Participants will learn about BPMN, a widely used modeling language, and how to create process models using BPMN.

  • C. Process Simulation

    Participants will learn about process simulation and how it can be used to test and validate process models.
items.summarytext:
Business Analysis Master Class Syllabus
I. Introduction to Business Analysis

A. Overview
In this section, participants will be introduced to the role of business analysis and its significance in driving organizational success.


B. Business Analysis Frameworks
Participants will learn about the various frameworks and methodologies used in business analysis, including the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) and the Agile Extension to the BABOK.


C. Business Analysis Process
Participants will learn about the business analysis process and how it contributes to the successful delivery of projects.


D. Business Analysis Techniques
Participants will learn about the various techniques used in business analysis, including requirements gathering, modeling, and prototyping.

II. Requirements Gathering and Management

A. Stakeholder Analysis
Participants will learn about stakeholder analysis and how to identify, prioritize, and engage stakeholders in the requirements gathering process.


B. Requirements Elicitation
Participants will learn about the various techniques used for requirements elicitation, including interviews, workshops, and surveys.


C. Requirements Documentation
Participants will learn about the importance of documenting requirements and how to create clear and concise requirement specifications.


D. Requirements Management
Participants will learn about requirements management, including how to maintain and update requirements throughout the project life cycle.

III. Business Process Modeling

A. Overview
Participants will learn about the various types of business process models and how they are used to represent the flow of business processes.


B. Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)
Participants will learn about BPMN, a widely used modeling language, and how to create process models using BPMN.


C. Process Simulation
Participants will learn about process simulation and how it can be used to test and validate process models.

  • Demonstrate how the skill of resilience can be applied to “bounce back”. 

 Topics 

Topics addressed in this module are: 

  • Definition and benefits of resilience 
  • Internal locus of control, self-awareness, and self-regulation 
  • Recognising and utilizing character strengths 
  • “Bouncing back” from unavoidable setbacks and retaining focus. 

This module should take 20 minutes to complete.
items.summarytext:
Purpose 
This module introduces new & existing employees to the importance of building resilience in the workplace. 
The module addresses the effects of workplace events on individual stress and goal-achievement, and how building resilience can benefit the individual’s ability to “bounce back” and stay on track. 
Learning outcomes 
By completing this module participants will be able to: 

Define resilience and outline why it is important in the workplace 
Identify a range of situations within and outside their locus of control 
Recognise how individual character strengths can help build resilience 
Demonstrate how the skill of resilience can be applied to “bounce back”. 

 Topics 
Topics addressed in this module are: 

Definition and benefits of resilience 
Internal locus of control, self-awareness, and self-regulation 
Recognising and utilizing character strengths 
“Bouncing back” from unavoidable setbacks and retaining focus. 

This module should take 20 minutes to complete.

items.summary:
Business Analysis Master Class Syllabus

I. Introduction to Business Analysis

  • A. Overview

    In this section, participants will be introduced to the role of business analysis and its significance in driving organizational success.

  • B. Business Analysis Frameworks

    Participants will learn about the various frameworks and methodologies used in business analysis, including the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) and the Agile Extension to the BABOK.

  • C. Business Analysis Process

    Participants will learn about the business analysis process and how it contributes to the successful delivery of projects.

  • D. Business Analysis Techniques

    Participants will learn about the various techniques used in business analysis, including requirements gathering, modeling, and prototyping.

II. Requirements Gathering and Management

  • A. Stakeholder Analysis

    Participants will learn about stakeholder analysis and how to identify, prioritize, and engage stakeholders in the requirements gathering process.

  • B. Requirements Elicitation

    Participants will learn about the various techniques used for requirements elicitation, including interviews, workshops, and surveys.

  • C. Requirements Documentation

    Participants will learn about the importance of documenting requirements and how to create clear and concise requirement specifications.

  • D. Requirements Management

    Participants will learn about requirements management, including how to maintain and update requirements throughout the project life cycle.

III. Business Process Modeling

  • A. Overview

    Participants will learn about the various types of business process models and how they are used to represent the flow of business processes.

  • B. Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)

    Participants will learn about BPMN, a widely used modeling language, and how to create process models using BPMN.

  • C. Process Simulation

    Participants will learn about process simulation and how it can be used to test and validate process models.
items.summarytext:
Business Analysis Master Class Syllabus
I. Introduction to Business Analysis

A. Overview
In this section, participants will be introduced to the role of business analysis and its significance in driving organizational success.


B. Business Analysis Frameworks
Participants will learn about the various frameworks and methodologies used in business analysis, including the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK) and the Agile Extension to the BABOK.


C. Business Analysis Process
Participants will learn about the business analysis process and how it contributes to the successful delivery of projects.


D. Business Analysis Techniques
Participants will learn about the various techniques used in business analysis, including requirements gathering, modeling, and prototyping.

II. Requirements Gathering and Management

A. Stakeholder Analysis
Participants will learn about stakeholder analysis and how to identify, prioritize, and engage stakeholders in the requirements gathering process.


B. Requirements Elicitation
Participants will learn about the various techniques used for requirements elicitation, including interviews, workshops, and surveys.


C. Requirements Documentation
Participants will learn about the importance of documenting requirements and how to create clear and concise requirement specifications.


D. Requirements Management
Participants will learn about requirements management, including how to maintain and update requirements throughout the project life cycle.

III. Business Process Modeling

A. Overview
Participants will learn about the various types of business process models and how they are used to represent the flow of business processes.


B. Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN)
Participants will learn about BPMN, a widely used modeling language, and how to create process models using BPMN.


C. Process Simulation
Participants will learn about process simulation and how it can be used to test and validate process models.
